result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly J. Lowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today.
Concurrent with: 13CF297.

miscConds.notes:
Subject to Work Release.
NOT subject to Good Time.
May not possess/use firearms or body armor.

May not vote until civil rights are restored.
If not a US citizen, may face deportation.
Cannot hold elected office.
Other civil rights may be lost until restored.
Not to have contact with Kimberly Benjamine-Rivers except as directed through any family court proceedings or Probation.
No domestic relationships unless approved by probation.

Compas evaluation and follow through with recommendations. 
Continue counseling.
Follow rules of Probation.
Must provide DNA sample - no surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Conditional time banked for Probation to use if necessary.

CASES: 13CF297 & 14CF168. Defendant Kelly J. Lowe in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 10:45 am.  Victim Impact Statement given.  Exh 1/Exh 2-obj by Amann, O&R.  11:29-recess.  12:03 pm-back on the record.  CT finds not elig for CIP, but elig for earned release pgm.

13CF297-Count 1-battery-Order 9 mo PCJ, subj to GT & WR.  Credit to be submitted in 2 wks.  Misd-$243 costs only.  Must report no later than 7/17/15 at 6 pm.

14CF168-Count 3-Order 6 yr WSP, 3 IC & 3 ES - I&S. Prob up to 3 yrs, impose 1 yr CT-banked for probation.  Subj to WR, no GT.  Probation to run concurrent w/ 13CF297.

On both-NC w/ Ms Benjamin except as directed through any family court proceedings or probation.  No domestic relationship unless approved by probation.  COMPAS & follow thru.  Continue counseling.  Follow rules of probation.  No DNA surcharge.  Must submit DNA sample.  
On felony - NO firearms, no votiing until civil rights restored, if not US citizen face deportation, cannot hold elected office, no body armor, other civil rights may be lost until restored.  Must report to probation today.  PCR.  12:40 pm adj.
